analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /

analyzed: sku skrun pa'i yum la thugs brtse ba'i phyir dge slong brgyad stong gi dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po thams cad kyang dgra bcom pa /

original: zag pa zad pa /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa /
translated: had exhausted the defilements,

original: rdzu 'phrul che ba /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul che ba /
translated: had great miraculous powers,

original: dbang che bar grags pa /
analyzed: dbang che bar grags pa /
translated: were renowned for their great power,

original: mthu chen po sha stag dang / byang chub sems dpa' bdun khri @209a *//
analyzed: mthu chen po sha stag dang / byang chub sems dpa' bdun khri @209a *//

original: nyis stong thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa' mngon par shes pas mngon par shes pa /
analyzed: nyis stong thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa' mngon par shes pas mngon par shes pa /
translated: All two thousand of them were bodhisattvas who had attained the superknowledges.

original: bzod pa thob pa /
analyzed: bzod pa thob pa /
translated: All of them were bodhisattvas who had attained acceptance, were endowed with the superknowledges, and were unimpeded in their eloquence.🔽Most of them had gathered from different world systems.

original: spobs pa thogs pa med pa phal cher 'jig rten gyi khams tha dad pa nas 'dus pa sha stag dang thabs cig tu dbyar gnas par zhal gyis bzhes nas de na bcom ldan 'das 'khor 'bum phrag du mas yongs su bskor cing mdun gyis bltas te chos ston
analyzed: spobs pa thogs pa med pa phal cher 'jig rten gyi khams tha dad pa nas 'dus pa sha stag dang thabs cig tu dbyar gnas par zhal gyis bzhes nas de na bcom ldan 'das 'khor 'bum phrag du mas yongs su bskor cing mdun gyis bltas te chos ston
translated: The Blessed One was teaching the Dharma, surrounded by and revered by many hundreds of thousands of followers.

original: to // de nas de'i tshe lha'i bu zla ba zhes bya ba dang / zla mchog ces bya ba gnyis 'khor de nyid kyi nang du 'dus par gyur te 'dug go /
analyzed: to // de nas de'i tshe lha'i bu zla ba zhes bya ba dang / zla mchog ces bya ba gnyis 'khor de nyid kyi nang du 'dus par gyur te 'dug go /
translated: At that time, two gods, Candra and Sucandra, were present in the assembly.

original: de nas lha'i bu zla ba stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas bus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol
analyzed: de nas lha'i bu zla ba stan las langs te bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas bus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol
translated: Then the god Candra rose from his seat, draped his upper robe over one shoulder, and knelt on his right knee. He bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined and made this request:🔽“Blessed One, I have a question for you, but if you will not answer it, I will not ask it.”

original: to // gal te zhus nas zhu ba lung bstan pa'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la skabs phye na /
analyzed: to // gal te zhus nas zhu ba lung bstan pa'i slad du bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la skabs phye na /
translated: If the Blessed One would grant me the opportunity to ask a question and explain the answer,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la bdag phyogs 'ga' zhig zhu'o //🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i bu zla ba la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la bdag phyogs 'ga' zhig zhu'o // de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i bu zla ba la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: I would like to ask the Blessed One, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect Buddha, a few questions.”

original: zla ba / khyod su'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa la zhu bar 'dod /
analyzed: zla ba / khyod su'i don du de bzhin gshegs pa la zhu bar 'dod /
translated: The Blessed One replied to the god Candra, “Candra, for whose sake do you wish to ask the Thus-Gone One?”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha'i bu zla bas tshigs su bcad de gsol pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha'i bu zla bas tshigs su bcad de gsol pa /
translated: Then the god Candra offered the following verse to the Blessed One:

original: gang dag @209b bdag la sman dang sems can gzhan la sman slad zhugs //
analyzed: gang dag @209b bdag la sman dang sems can gzhan la sman slad zhugs //
translated: “I ask for the sake of my own healing and the healing of other beings.

original: sems can kun la snying rje snying brtse legs par bskyed nas ni //
analyzed: sems can kun la snying rje snying brtse legs par bskyed nas ni //
translated: Having generated compassion and love for all beings,

original: byang chub rdul bral bdud rtsi 'tshal zhing don du sgrub bgyid pa //
analyzed: byang chub rdul bral bdud rtsi 'tshal zhing don du sgrub bgyid pa //
translated: I seek and accomplish the deathless nectar of immaculate awakening.

original: sh'akya sengge bdag ni de dag don du zhu ba zhu //
analyzed: sh'akya sengge bdag ni de dag don du zhu ba zhu //
translated: Lion of the Śākyas, I ask for their sake.”

original: gang dag ma zhum sems kyis bskal pa bye bar spyod bgyid cing //
analyzed: gang dag ma zhum sems kyis bskal pa bye bar spyod bgyid cing //
translated: Those who, with an undaunted mind, practice for millions of eons,🔽Abandoning suffering and liberating all beings,

original: sdug bsngal spong la 'gro ba thams cad kyang ni grol bar bgyid; ;gang dag sems can kun la sems snyoms sbyor ba snyoms par bgyid //
analyzed: sdug bsngal spong la 'gro ba thams cad kyang ni grol bar bgyid; ;gang dag sems can kun la sems snyoms sbyor ba snyoms par bgyid //
translated: Those who have an impartial mind toward all sentient beings and engage in impartiality,

original: bdag ni mi 'dren de dag don du rgyal la zhu ba lags //🔽gang dag sangs rgyas mtshan mchog gsum cu rtsa gnyis rtags rnams kyis //
analyzed: bdag ni mi 'dren de dag don du rgyal la zhu ba lags // gang dag sangs rgyas mtshan mchog gsum cu rtsa gnyis rtags rnams kyis //
translated: I ask this of the Victor for their sake, not for my own.🔽Those who see the body of the Buddha, adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being,

original: sku spras rdul dang bral ba bsod nams zhing chen mthong gyur nas //
analyzed: sku spras rdul dang bral ba bsod nams zhing chen mthong gyur nas //
translated: The great field of merit, free from dust,

original: yon tan rgya mtsho gang chen mtsho rnams de dag 'dod bgyid pa //
analyzed: yon tan rgya mtsho gang chen mtsho rnams de dag 'dod bgyid pa //
translated: Desiring the great ocean-like qualities,

original: gzi brjid chen po de dag don du bdag ni zhu ba lags //🔽gang dag rtag tu skyes bu khyu mchog ye shes ma gtogs par //
analyzed: gzi brjid chen po de dag don du bdag ni zhu ba lags // gang dag rtag tu skyes bu khyu mchog ye shes ma gtogs par //
translated: I ask this of the Victor for their sake, not for my own.🔽Those who, at all times, do not direct their mind to anything other than the wisdom of the supreme being,

original: gzhan du blo gros mi bskyed gzhan du sems par mi bgyid dang // gang dag nyan thos rang rgyal dag tu blo gros mi skyed pa //
analyzed: gzhan du blo gros mi bskyed gzhan du sems par mi bgyid dang // gang dag nyan thos rang rgyal dag tu blo gros mi skyed pa //
translated: Those who do not think of anything else, who do not direct their mind to the śrāvakas or pratyekabuddhas,

original: rtsal rab brtan pa de dag don du bdag ni zhu ba lags //
analyzed: rtsal rab brtan pa de dag don du bdag ni zhu ba lags //
translated: I ask this for the sake of those who are steadfast in their power.

original: gang dag rnyed dang ma rnyed grags dang ma grags mnyam par sems //
analyzed: gang dag rnyed dang ma rnyed grags dang ma grags mnyam par sems //
translated: Those whose minds are the same toward gain and loss, fame and disgrace,

original: smad dang bsngags dang bde dang sdug bsngal dag gis skyo mi 'gyur //
analyzed: smad dang bsngags dang bde dang sdug bsngal dag gis skyo mi 'gyur //
translated: who are not discouraged by criticism, praise, happiness, or suffering,

original: 'jig rten chos rnams zil gyis mnan te gnas shing bskyod ma mchis //🔽'jigs dang bral ba de dag @210a *//
analyzed: 'jig rten chos rnams zil gyis mnan te gnas shing bskyod ma mchis // 'jigs dang bral ba de dag @210a *//
translated: who remain victorious over worldly dharmas and are unshakable,

original: don du bdag ni zhu ba lags //
analyzed: don du bdag ni zhu ba lags //
translated: I ask this for the sake of those who are free from fear.

original: gang dag bdag phangs mtshungs 'drar gzhan dag la yang phangs par 'dzin //
analyzed: gang dag bdag phangs mtshungs 'drar gzhan dag la yang phangs par 'dzin //
translated: Those who cherish others as much as they cherish themselves,

original: srid pa gsum na tha dad 'byed pa ma mchis sbyor ba mnyam //
analyzed: srid pa gsum na tha dad 'byed pa ma mchis sbyor ba mnyam //
translated: who are impartial and apply themselves equally in the three realms,

original: gang dag byams par sems shing tshul 'chos tha ba skyon ma mchis //
analyzed: gang dag byams par sems shing tshul 'chos tha ba skyon ma mchis //
translated: who are loving, without hypocrisy or faults,

original: skye bo de dag rnams kyi don du bdag ni zhu ba lags //
analyzed: skye bo de dag rnams kyi don du bdag ni zhu ba lags //
translated: I ask this for the sake of those beings.

original: gang dag rtag tu sbyin dang tshul khrims dag cing rnam dag spyod //
analyzed: gang dag rtag tu sbyin dang tshul khrims dag cing rnam dag spyod //
translated: Those who are always generous, disciplined, and pure in conduct,

original: bdag nyid spong bar bgyid kyi tshul khrims phung po gtong mi bgyid //
analyzed: bdag nyid spong bar bgyid kyi tshul khrims phung po gtong mi bgyid //
translated: I do not abandon the aggregate of morality.

original: gang dag rtag tu lus dang ngag dang yid rnams legs par bsdams //
analyzed: gang dag rtag tu lus dang ngag dang yid rnams legs par bsdams //
translated: Those who always restrain their body, speech, and mind,

original: bdag ni dri med de dag don du rgyal la zhu ba lags //
analyzed: bdag ni dri med de dag don du rgyal la zhu ba lags //
translated: I ask the Victor for the sake of those stainless ones.

original: gang dag bzod pa smra zhing legs par bsdams pa'i shes dang ldan //
analyzed: gang dag bzod pa smra zhing legs par bsdams pa'i shes dang ldan //

analyzed: sdug bsngal dang ni bsad dang bcings dang brdeg pa rnams kyang bzod //

original: kun gyis dkrugs kyang khro ba dang ni bskyed par mi bgyid pa //
analyzed: kun gyis dkrugs kyang khro ba dang ni bskyed par mi bgyid pa //
translated: Who do not give rise to anger even when disturbed by all,

original: nges par bgyid pa de dag don du bdag ni zhu ba lags //
analyzed: nges par bgyid pa de dag don du bdag ni zhu ba lags //
translated: I ask the Victor for the sake of those who definitely do that.

original: gang dag mthu dang brtson 'grus stobs gnas dam pa'i don dang ldan //
analyzed: gang dag mthu dang brtson 'grus stobs gnas dam pa'i don dang ldan //
translated: Those who abide in strength, diligence, and the highest meaning,

analyzed: 'jig rten don gyi slad du rgyu zhing bdag gi phyir ma lags //

analyzed: dkar po'i spyod pa rnams kyis mi ngoms rgya mtsho'i chab dang 'dra //

original: yon tan rgya mtsho de dag don du rgyal la zhu ba lags //
analyzed: yon tan rgya mtsho de dag don du rgyal la zhu ba lags //

analyzed: gang dag rnam par rtog pa sna tshogs shas cher mi 'jug pa //

analyzed: bsam gtan gnas pa de dag don du bdag ni zhu ba lags //

analyzed: gang gis chos 'di dben zhing ya ma brlar yang rtogs gyur pa //

analyzed: gang zag chen po de dag don du bdag ni zhu ba lags //

analyzed: mun dang bral ba de dag don du bdag ni zhu ba lags //

analyzed: byang chub rdul med ye shes mchog ni 'tshang rgya dang // gang dag sems gcig la ni shes pa ci mchis 'byung 'gyur ba //

analyzed: rdo rje lta bu de dag don du bdag ni zhu ba lags //

analyzed: shes rab kyi snang ba chen po bya bar 'dod pa rnams dang / ye shes chen po'i rjes su 'gro bar 'dod pa rnams dang; ye shes chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed 'dod pa de dag dang / de lta bur yon tan tshad med pa dang ldan pa'i sems can de dag gi don du de bzhin gshegs pa la zhu bar byed pa khyod legs so //

original: lha'i mig gis phyogs bcur sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med pa dag mthong ngo //
analyzed: lha'i mig gis phyogs bcur sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag dpag tu med pa dag mthong ngo //
translated: sees with his divine eye the countless quintillions of buddhafields in the ten directions.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa gang dag bzhugs ba de dag kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa gang dag bzhugs ba de dag kyang mthong ngo //
translated: He sees the lord buddhas who are there, together with the assemblies of śrāvakas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag chos bstan pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang lha'i rna ba'i khams kyis thams cad thos so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag chos bstan pa gang dag yin pa de dag kyang lha'i rna ba'i khams kyis thams cad thos so //
translated: He hears with his divine ear all the teachings of those lord buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing @214b de dag na sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dang spyod pa tha ma dang / 'bring dang / rab dag gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang rab tu shes so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing @214b de dag na sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dang spyod pa tha ma dang / 'bring dang / rab dag gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows the inferior, middling, and superior thoughts and actions of the beings in those buddha-fields.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag thams cad du'ang skad cig de la 'gro'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag thams cad du'ang skad cig de la 'gro'o //
translated: In a single instant he goes to all those buddha-fields.

original: de bdag nyid kyi sngon gyi gnas shes pa mngon sum du byed pa las kyang brtsams nas chos ston par byed de /
analyzed: de bdag nyid kyi sngon gyi gnas shes pa mngon sum du byed pa las kyang brtsams nas chos ston par byed de /
translated: He teaches the Dharma, beginning with the knowledge of his own former lives.

original: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ye shes de lta bu dang ldan pa ni /
translated: “Divine Prince, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who has such knowledge

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob par yang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi bya bas nye bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob par yang sems can rnams la sangs rgyas kyi bya bas nye bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: is engaged in the activities of a buddha for beings even before attaining omniscience.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyang myur du yongs su rdzogs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyang myur du yongs su rdzogs nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will quickly perfect all the qualities of the Buddha and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag bka' stsal to //
translated: Then the Bhagavān spoke these verses:

original: thabs shes pa la mkhas shing gsal ba ni //
analyzed: thabs shes pa la mkhas shing gsal ba ni //
translated: “Those who are skilled and clear in the knowledge of means

original: mngon shes chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed //
analyzed: mngon shes chen po yongs su rdzogs par byed //
translated: Will perfect the great superknowledges.

original: rtag tu chos kun nam mkha' lta bur shes //
analyzed: rtag tu chos kun nam mkha' lta bur shes //
translated: They will always know all phenomena to be like space

original: de ni zab mo'i tshul khrims ldan pa yin //
analyzed: de ni zab mo'i tshul khrims ldan pa yin //
translated: And will possess the profound discipline.

original: chos rnams thams cad ji bzhin shes pa yi //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ji bzhin shes pa yi //
translated: The wise ones, who know all phenomena as they are,

original: mkhas pa mngon par zhen pa mi byed de //
analyzed: mkhas pa mngon par zhen pa mi byed de //
translated: Do not cling to anything.🔽They will always know all phenomena to be like space

original: rtag tu chos kun nam mkha' lta bu dang // rtag tu stong pa'i bdag med shes pa yin //
analyzed: rtag tu chos kun nam mkha' lta bu dang // rtag tu stong pa'i bdag med shes pa yin //
translated: And will always know emptiness and the absence of self.

original: chos dang chos kyi dbyings la mthun par sbyor //
analyzed: chos dang chos kyi dbyings la mthun par sbyor //
translated: They will be in harmony with the Dharma and the realm of phenomena,

original: chos kyi dbyings la ma gtogs mthong ba med //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la ma gtogs mthong ba med //
translated: And will not see anything apart from the realm of phenomena.

original: gang gis de mthong de yang lhag par mthong //🔽de ltar mngon par brtson @215a *//
analyzed: gang gis de mthong de yang lhag par mthong // de ltar mngon par brtson @215a *//
translated: And whoever sees that sees the supreme.

original: pas mngon shes 'thob //
analyzed: pas mngon shes 'thob //
translated: Thus, through such exertion, one attains higher perception.

original: sngon gyi chos rnams ji ltar stong pa bzhin //
analyzed: sngon gyi chos rnams ji ltar stong pa bzhin //
translated: Just as past phenomena are empty,🔽So future phenomena are empty,

original: ma 'ongs pa rnams de bzhin stong pa dang // des ni da ltar byung ba'ang de bzhin mthong //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnams de bzhin stong pa dang // des ni da ltar byung ba'ang de bzhin mthong //
translated: And one sees the present in the same way.

original: de dag sngon chad ji bzhin brjod pa yin //
analyzed: de dag sngon chad ji bzhin brjod pa yin //
translated: I have described them as they were before.

original: chos rnams thams cad rtag tu dus gsum stong //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad rtag tu dus gsum stong //
translated: All phenomena are always empty in the three times.

original: mkhas pa mi rtog rnam par rtog mi byed //
analyzed: mkhas pa mi rtog rnam par rtog mi byed //
translated: The wise do not conceptualize or think.

original: mi rtog rnam par rtog par mi byed na /
analyzed: mi rtog rnam par rtog par mi byed na /
translated: When they do not conceptualize or think,

original: ;ji bzhin mthong ba la ni 'jigs pa med //
analyzed: ;ji bzhin mthong ba la ni 'jigs pa med //
translated: They see things as they are and have no fear.

original: de nyid shes ldan mkhas la gsal ba ste //
analyzed: de nyid shes ldan mkhas la gsal ba ste //
translated: The wise and learned who know that

original: chos kyang ston la chos kyi 'du shes med //🔽rlom sems med pa la ni rten pa'ang med //
analyzed: chos kyang ston la chos kyi 'du shes med // rlom sems med pa la ni rten pa'ang med //
translated: Teach the Dharma without any notion of Dharma.🔽Those who are free of conceit have no support.

original: rten pa med pa la ni g-yo ba'ang med //
analyzed: rten pa med pa la ni g-yo ba'ang med //
translated: Those who have no support have no movement.

original: chos 'di thams cad bdag las byung ba ste //
analyzed: chos 'di thams cad bdag las byung ba ste //
translated: All these phenomena arise from the self,

original: de ni bdag med rang bzhin bdag med de //
analyzed: de ni bdag med rang bzhin bdag med de //
translated: But that self is selfless and has no intrinsic self.

original: chos 'di thams cad bdag med rtogs nas kyang //
analyzed: chos 'di thams cad bdag med rtogs nas kyang //
translated: “Having realized that all phenomena are devoid of self,

original: mkhas pa chos gzhan kun nas slong mi byed //
analyzed: mkhas pa chos gzhan kun nas slong mi byed //
translated: The wise do not engage in any other Dharma.

original: ma skyes gang yin de ni 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ma skyes gang yin de ni 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: What is unborn will not come into being,

original: de ni de la mngon par zhen pa med //
analyzed: de ni de la mngon par zhen pa med //
translated: And they will not cling to it.

original: rnam par gzhag pas chos kun ston par byed //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pas chos kun ston par byed //
translated: “They teach all phenomena through their presentation,

original: chos rnams ston kyang bdag la sems pa med //
analyzed: chos rnams ston kyang bdag la sems pa med //
translated: But they do not think of themselves as teachers.

original: srid gsum thams cad sems las 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: srid gsum thams cad sems las 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: The three existences are all accomplished through the mind,

original: sems de nyid kyang rtag tu bstan du med; ;gzugs med lung du ma bstan sgyu ma 'dra //
analyzed: sems de nyid kyang rtag tu bstan du med; ;gzugs med lung du ma bstan sgyu ma 'dra //
translated: And that mind itself is always unobservable.

original: mkhas pa de ni sems kyi chos nyid tshol //
analyzed: mkhas pa de ni sems kyi chos nyid tshol //
translated: “The wise seek the nature of the mind,🔽Which is formless, neutral, and illusory.

original: de ni sems kyi chos nyid tshol ba na //
analyzed: de ni sems kyi chos nyid tshol ba na //
translated: When they seek the nature of the mind,🔽They do not see the mind or the nature of the mind.

original: sems dang sems kyi chos nyid mthong @215b ba med; ;sems de sems gang gis ni tshol byed pa //
analyzed: sems dang sems kyi chos nyid mthong @215b ba med; ;sems de sems gang gis ni tshol byed pa //
translated: The mind that seeks the mind

original: sems de yang ni rang bzhin mthong ba med //
analyzed: sems de yang ni rang bzhin mthong ba med //
translated: Does not see the nature of the mind.

original: de ni chos rnams kun gyis mi gos te //
analyzed: de ni chos rnams kun gyis mi gos te //
translated: “They are unstained by any phenomena,

original: de yi mtshan ma 'dod chags 'jug pa med //
analyzed: de yi mtshan ma 'dod chags 'jug pa med //
translated: And the signs of desire do not engage them.

original: de ni chos kun ma grub shes nas kyang //
analyzed: de ni chos kun ma grub shes nas kyang //
translated: And knowing that all phenomena are unaccomplished,

original: de yis rtag tu nam mkha' lta bur shes //
analyzed: de yis rtag tu nam mkha' lta bur shes //
translated: They always know them to be like space.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' skyes par ma gyur pa //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' skyes par ma gyur pa //
translated: Just as space is unborn,

original: de bzhin de yis chos rnams thams cad shes //
analyzed: de bzhin de yis chos rnams thams cad shes //
translated: So they know all phenomena.

original: snying po med pa nam mkha' ming gis byas //
analyzed: snying po med pa nam mkha' ming gis byas //
translated: The essenceless is designated by the name “space.”

original: chos rnams stong pa mig gis rnam par brjod //
analyzed: chos rnams stong pa mig gis rnam par brjod //
translated: The emptiness of phenomena is expressed by the eye.

original: nam yang rna bas mig ni mthong ba med //
analyzed: nam yang rna bas mig ni mthong ba med //
translated: The eye is never seen by the ear,

original: rna ba yis ni nam yang mig ma mthong //
analyzed: rna ba yis ni nam yang mig ma mthong //
translated: And the ear is never seen by the eye.

original: snas kyang lce min lces kyang sna ma yin //
analyzed: snas kyang lce min lces kyang sna ma yin //
translated: The nose is not the tongue, and the tongue is not the nose.

original: de dag gcig la gcig ni mthong ba med //🔽lus kyis nam yang yid ni mthong mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de dag gcig la gcig ni mthong ba med // lus kyis nam yang yid ni mthong mi 'gyur //
translated: They do not see each other.🔽The mind is never seen by the body,

original: yid kyis nam yang lus ni mthong ba med //
analyzed: yid kyis nam yang lus ni mthong ba med //
translated: And the body is never seen by the mind.🔽They do not impute to each other,

original: 'di dag phan tshun 'dogs par mi byed de; ;de phyir 'di dag rtag tu dben pa yin //
analyzed: 'di dag phan tshun 'dogs par mi byed de; ;de phyir 'di dag rtag tu dben pa yin //
translated: And so they are always isolated.

original: spyod med byed pa med pa bem po ste //
analyzed: spyod med byed pa med pa bem po ste //
translated: They are inactive, inert,

original: chos kyi dbyings la rtag tu mtshungs shing mnyam //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la rtag tu mtshungs shing mnyam //
translated: And always the same in the realm of phenomena.

original: nang yang phyi rol dag gis mi shes la //
analyzed: nang yang phyi rol dag gis mi shes la //
translated: The inner does not know the outer,

original: phyi rol dag kyang nang gis mi shes so //
analyzed: phyi rol dag kyang nang gis mi shes so //
translated: And the outer does not know the inner.

original: de phyir chos rnams 'di dag rab shes pa //
analyzed: de phyir chos rnams 'di dag rab shes pa //
translated: Therefore, knowing these phenomena well,

original: rtag tu de yi shes pa mtha' yang yas //
analyzed: rtag tu de yi shes pa mtha' yang yas //
translated: Their knowledge is always inexhaustible.

original: phyogs bcur sangs rgyas bye ba nyan thos bcas //
analyzed: phyogs bcur sangs rgyas bye ba nyan thos bcas //
translated: Even if they see ten million buddhas in the ten directions, along with their śrāvakas,

original: mthong du zin kyang rtog bar mi byed do //
analyzed: mthong du zin kyang rtog bar mi byed do //
translated: They do not conceptualize them.

original: shes rab mtha' yas tshul khrims sar dag pa //
analyzed: shes rab mtha' yas tshul khrims sar dag pa //
translated: With their pure ground of discipline and infinite wisdom,

original: de dag chos rnams ston pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: de dag chos rnams ston pa gang yin pa //
translated: Whatever Dharma they teach

original: legs par gsungs pa de dag thams cad thos //🔽bzung nas kyang ni yang dag @216a *//
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa de dag thams cad thos // bzung nas kyang ni yang dag @216a *//
translated: They hear it all well-spoken,

original: 'dzin par byed //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed //
translated: And having heard it, they retain it correctly.

original: des ni sems can kun gyi sems kyang shes //
analyzed: des ni sems can kun gyi sems kyang shes //
translated: They know the minds of all beings,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis ni zhing rnams bye bar 'gro /🔽bskal pa bye ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis ni zhing rnams bye bar 'gro / bskal pa bye ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa //
translated: And with their miraculous powers they go to millions of realms.🔽They remember their previous lives for inconceivable millions of eons,

original: gangg'a'i bye snyed sngon gyi gnas kyang dran //
analyzed: gangg'a'i bye snyed sngon gyi gnas kyang dran //
translated: As many as there are sands in the Ganges.

original: de phyir mngon shes lnga po 'di bsgoms na //
analyzed: de phyir mngon shes lnga po 'di bsgoms na //
translated: Therefore, having cultivated these five higher perceptions,

original: bde gshegs ye shes dang yang nye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: bde gshegs ye shes dang yang nye bar 'gyur //
translated: They draw near to the wisdom of the Sugatas.

original: mkhas de rtag tu sangs rgyas bye bas gnas /
analyzed: mkhas de rtag tu sangs rgyas bye bas gnas /
translated: The wise one is always sustained by millions of buddhas.

original: byang chub ma thob par yang don byed 'gyur //
analyzed: byang chub ma thob par yang don byed 'gyur //
translated: Even before attaining awakening, he will accomplish the aims of beings.

original: gang zhig 'di 'dra'i chos bstan thos nas kyang //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di 'dra'i chos bstan thos nas kyang //
translated: Whoever, having heard this kind of teaching of the Dharma,

original: dga' ba rgya chen gtso bo skye 'gyur ba //
analyzed: dga' ba rgya chen gtso bo skye 'gyur ba //
translated: Gives rise to the foremost, vast joy,

original: de la bdud kyis tshugs par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: de la bdud kyis tshugs par mi 'gyur te //
translated: Māra will not be able to assail him;

original: myur du byang chub mchog tu rdzogs 'tshang rgya //🔽lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos bzhi dang ldan na /
analyzed: myur du byang chub mchog tu rdzogs 'tshang rgya // lha'i bu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos bzhi dang ldan na /
translated: He will quickly awaken to supreme enlightenment.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i thabs shes pa la mkhas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i thabs shes pa la mkhas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: “Divine prince, when bodhisattva mahāsattvas have four qualities, they should be known as skilled in the means of knowing the inconceivable.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: lha'i bu / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
analyzed: lha'i bu / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni /
translated: Divine prince, here bodhisattva mahāsattvas

original: thabs la mkhas pa yin te /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa yin te /
translated: are skilled in means.

original: de ji lta ji ltar bdag nyid sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams kyis gnod par gyur par mthong ba de lta de ltar sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal zhi bar bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
analyzed: de ji lta ji ltar bdag nyid sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams kyis gnod par gyur par mthong ba de lta de ltar sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal zhi bar bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom ste /
translated: The more he sees himself afflicted by suffering, mental unhappiness, and disturbance, the more he strives to eliminate the suffering of sentient beings.

original: des sems can thams cad kyang byang chub kyi sems la nges par 'dogs la chos thams cad kyang byang chub kyi sems la nges par 'dogs so //
analyzed: des sems can thams cad kyang byang chub kyi sems la nges par 'dogs la chos thams cad kyang byang chub kyi sems la nges par 'dogs so //
translated: He establishes all sentient beings in the thought of awakening and establishes all phenomena in the thought of awakening.

original: de sems @216b can thams cad kyi dus gsum du yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i bsod nams thams cad kyi phung po la'ang rjes su yi rang bar byed la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dus gsum du yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po la rjes su🔽yi rang bar byed de /
analyzed: de sems @216b can thams cad kyi dus gsum du yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i bsod nams thams cad kyi phung po la'ang rjes su yi rang bar byed la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dus gsum du yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po la rjes su yi rang bar byed de /
translated: He rejoices in the entire mass of merit of all sentient beings that is accomplished in the three times. He rejoices in the entire mass of merit of all the buddhas that is accomplished in the three times.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang sems can de dag thams cad nyid la 'dor zhing yongs su gtong bar byed de /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang sems can de dag thams cad nyid la 'dor zhing yongs su gtong bar byed de /
translated: He dedicates that wholesome action to all those sentient beings.

original: gang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su mi bsngo ba'i sems bskyed pa'ang med la sems la ma gtogs pa'i byang chub kyang yang dag par ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su mi bsngo ba'i sems bskyed pa'ang med la sems la ma gtogs pa'i byang chub kyang yang dag par ma mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see any thought that is not dedicated to omniscience, nor does he see any enlightenment that is not included in thought.

original: byang chub kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa sems kyi mtshan nyid kyang de yin par shes nas 'dra bar byed do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa sems kyi mtshan nyid kyang de yin par shes nas 'dra bar byed do //
translated: He knows that the characteristic of thought is the same as the characteristic of enlightenment, and he makes them the same.

original: sems dang byang chub la'ang mngon par zhen pa med la thabs shes pas dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang rnam par 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: sems dang byang chub la'ang mngon par zhen pa med la thabs shes pas dge ba'i rtsa ba'ang rnam par 'phel bar byed do //
translated: He does not cling to thought or to enlightenment, and through his skill in means he increases his wholesome roots.

original: des chos kyi dbyings kyang rnam par dag par yang dag par mi mthong la /
analyzed: des chos kyi dbyings kyang rnam par dag par yang dag par mi mthong la /
translated: He does not see the purity of the dharma-element,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos rnams rtogs pas dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par sgrub pa la'ang chog mi shes so //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos rnams rtogs pas dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par sgrub pa la'ang chog mi shes so //
translated: and he is not satisfied with the accomplishment of his wholesome roots, because he has realized the inconceivable dharmas.

original: sems kyi las dang / dge ba'i sems la'ang mchog tu 'dzin pa med do //
analyzed: sems kyi las dang / dge ba'i sems la'ang mchog tu 'dzin pa med do //
translated: He does not consider the activity of thought or the thought of wholesomeness to be supreme.

original: de sbyin pa'ang sbyin par byed la de la'ang rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: de sbyin pa'ang sbyin par byed la de la'ang rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: He gives gifts, but he does not conceptualize them.

original: tshul khrims kyang srung la de la mchog tu 'dzin pa'ang med do //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyang srung la de la mchog tu 'dzin pa'ang med do //
translated: He also keeps moral discipline, but does not hold that as supreme.

original: bzod pa'ang sgom la de la'ang mi gnas so //
analyzed: bzod pa'ang sgom la de la'ang mi gnas so //
translated: He also cultivates patience, but does not dwell on that.

original: brtson 'grus kyang rtsom la de la'ang dben par shes so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyang rtsom la de la'ang dben par shes so //
translated: He also makes an effort at perseverance, but knows it to be isolated.

original: bsam gtan la'ang snyoms par @217a *//
analyzed: bsam gtan la'ang snyoms par @217a *//
translated: He also becomes absorbed in meditative concentration,

original: 'jug la de la'ang mi rten to //
analyzed: 'jug la de la'ang mi rten to //
translated: but does not rely on that.

original: shes rab la'ang spyod la de la'ang kun tu mi spyod do //
analyzed: shes rab la'ang spyod la de la'ang kun tu mi spyod do //
translated: He also practices wisdom, but does not engage in that.

original: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed la de'ang mi dmigs par spyod do //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed la de'ang mi dmigs par spyod do //
translated: He also brings beings to full maturity, but does so without apprehending anything.

original: zhing yang yongs su dag par byed la phan gdags pa'i tshul gyis byed do //
analyzed: zhing yang yongs su dag par byed la phan gdags pa'i tshul gyis byed do //
translated: He also purifies the buddhafields, but does so by way of not benefiting anyone.

original: ye shes kyang yongs su tshol la de'ang yongs su tshol ba med pa'i tshul gyis byed do //
analyzed: ye shes kyang yongs su tshol la de'ang yongs su tshol ba med pa'i tshul gyis byed do //
